statement:
Erdős-Turan conjecture asserts there exist no $A\subset {\mathbb{N}}_0$
of order $2$ such that its representation function
$$r'_{A,2}(n)=\sum_{\substack{a_1+a_2=n\\a_1\leq a_2}} 1$$ is bounded.

Alternatively, the question can be phrased as whether there exists a
power series $F$ with coefficients $0$ and $1$ such that all
coefficients of $F^2$ are greater than $0$, but are bounded.

If we replace set of nonnegative integers by the set of all integers,
then the question was settled by Nathanson[@cite:nathanson_everyrepr] in
negative, that is, there exists a set $A\subset {\mathbb{Z}}$ such that
$r'_{A,2}(n)=1$.

[1]{}

Heini Halberstam and Klaus Friedrich Roth. . Springer-Verlag, second
edition, 1983. .

Melvyn B. Nathanson. Every function is the representation function of an
additive basis for the integers. .
